instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2850 kernal panic
threads.message: Hi , ive got an 820-2850 board that kernal panics after booting to os within 10 seconds , ive changed c9650 still the same, no signs of liquid damage and wont run ASD , is there anything else i can check ?

threads.title: 820-2850 kernal panic
threads.message: Have you triedv known good OS and correct memory?

threads.title: 820-2850 kernal panic
threads.message: yes tried memory and even tried loading os on new drive but no joy

threads.title: 820-2850 kernal panic
threads.message: Tried 1 RAM slot at a time? Besides that I don't think there is much you can do with this one unless there is something obvious. Any history as to how this happened is also very important.

threads.title: 820-2850 kernal panic
threads.message: the only history i got was customer changed the screen because it was going "fuzzy" and ended up with no display, found they had knocked off L9000 and thought happy days picture back and then started kernal panic :-(

threads.title: 820-2850 kernal panic
threads.message:
If they managed to knock off a complete coil it might be missing more, inspect the board. 

Can you upload a screenshot (or picture) of the kernel panic with the text visible? Did you already try a known good installation so we can exclude it being a damaged hard drive or OS?

threads.title: 820-2850 kernal panic
threads.message: Could be absolutely anything then, full inspection for component damage. Also expect MUX issues as the LCD was of course never the issue.
